marketNews.title: Danantara Releases Patriot Bonds Worth Rp50 Trillion
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that BPI Danantara plans to issue Patriot Bonds worth 50 trillion rupiah on 1 October 2025. The bond issuance is said to consist of two series with tenors of 5 years and 7 years, each worth 25 trillion rupiah and carrying a coupon of 2%, below the yield of comparable government bonds of around 6%. Because of the low yield, the bonds will be offered through a private placement to a number of national business leaders. Danantara’s Chief Investment Officer (CIO), Pandu Sjahrir, explained that the bonds are a strategic financing instrument commonly used in various countries, such as Japan and the United States, to strengthen national financing independence. The issuance is supported by several conglomerates including Prajogo Pangestu, Franky Widjaja, and Boy Thohir. Through its official LinkedIn page, Danantara said the funds raised from the bonds will be invested in the energy transition sector and others. Bloomberg also reported that the funds will be used for waste-to-energy (WTE) projects. The bond issuance is scheduled only one day after the Minister of Food Affairs, Zulkifli Hasan, said that the Presidential Regulation concerning WTE is expected to be issued within one to two days. According to the Electricity Supply Business Plan (RUPTL) of PLN for 2025, the development of waste-to-energy power plants based on environmentally friendly technology will be located in 12 cities: Palembang, Tangerang, South Tangerang, Jakarta, Bandung, Bekasi, Semarang, Surakarta, Surabaya, Makassar, Manado and Denpasar, with a total installed capacity of 453 MW by 2034. Key Takeaway The planned bond issuance provides positive sentiment to issuers that have exposure to the WTE business and its ecosystem such as $TOBA and $OASA, whose share prices rose respectively by +17.9% and +24.3% on the trading day Tuesday (26/8). TOBA completed in March 2025 the acquisition of Sembcorp Environment, a Singapore household waste management company located in Jurong. Meanwhile, OASA plans to partner with a Chinese company to build a solar-powered waste processing plant at the Cipeucang landfill in Serpong. The project is estimated at 1.69 trillion rupiah and will generate 15.7 MW of electricity.

tickerNews.title: $BBRI reports July 2025 net profit bank only of 3.8 trillion rupiah
tickerNews.content: $BBRI: Bank Rakyat Indonesia recorded net profit bank only of 3.8 trillion rupiah in July 2025 (+20% YoY, -38% MoM). This result makes net profit bank only for 7M25 reach 28.6 trillion rupiah (-9% YoY), equal to 50.3% of the 2025F consolidated consensus estimate (vs. 7M24 bank only: 52.2% actual consolidation 2024). The year-on-year increase in July 2025 profit was driven by a significant decline in provision expenses (-55% YoY, -12% MoM), although Pre-Provision Operating Profit (PPOP) was weak at 7.6 trillion rupiah (-28% YoY, -31% MoM). Cumulatively for 7M25, profit decline was driven by: 1) weak PPOP -4% YoY due to opex increase +10% YoY; and 2) provision expenses increased +4% YoY. As of July 2025, bank-only credit growth was +5% YoY, relatively stable compared with June 2025.

tickerNews.title: $PANI announces 300 billion rupiah private placement
tickerNews.content: $PANI: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua announced a private placement of 300 billion rupiah by issuing approximately 20.9 million new shares to be taken by the controlling shareholder, PT Multi Artha Pratama. The placement price is 14,350 rupiah per share, which is at least 90% of the average closing price over the last 25 trading days. The proceeds will be used to strengthen the capital structure of subsidiaries PT Cahaya Inti Sentosa, PT Panorama Eka Tunggal, and PT Karunia Utama Selaras. This corporate action is part of a private placement plan approved in the RUPSLB in June 2024.

tickerNews.title: $UNTR reports July 2025 Komatsu sales and coal production
tickerNews.content: $UNTR: United Tractors recorded sales of Komatsu heavy equipment amounting to 370 units in July 2025 (-2.4% MoM, +0.5% YoY). Cumulatively for 7M25, Komatsu sales reached 3,098 units (+23.2% YoY), equal to 67% of the 2025 target of 4,600 units, with market share stable at 24% (vs. 1H25: 24%, 7M24: 28%). From the mining contractor segment, UNTR reported coal production volume of 82.7 million tons (-1.4% YoY) during 7M25, with overburden removal of 637.9 million bcm (-8.8% YoY).

tickerNews.title: $BSDE VP purchases 3.3 million shares on 19 August 2025
tickerNews.content: $BSDE: Vice President Director of Bumi Serpong Damai, Michael J. P. Widjaja, purchased approximately 3.3 million BSDE shares at an average price of about 911 rupiah per share on 19 August 2025. The total transaction value was 3 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Michael J. P. Widjaja’s direct ownership increased from 0.04% to 0.06%.

tickerNews.title: $SRTG signals possible IPOs for three portfolio companies
tickerNews.content: $SRTG: The business reported that Saratoga Investama Sedaya shareholder Sandiaga Salahuddin Uno signaled a possible IPO plan for three portfolio companies of SRTG within the next 2-3 years, namely beauty clinic ZAP, restaurant brand Misoa Story, and hotel operator Bobobox. Previously, in January 2025, SRTG Investment Director Devin Wirawan mentioned the possibility of an IPO for MGM Bosco Logistics, a cold-chain logistics business, and energy company Xurya Energy.

tickerNews.title: $WIKA reports new contract value of 4.78 trillion rupiah in 7M25
tickerNews.content: $WIKA: Director General of Wijaya Karya, Agung Budi Waskito, said the company recorded new contract value of 4.78 trillion rupiah during 7M25 (-59% YoY). The new contracts were dominated by construction supporting industry sector at 49.7%, followed by infrastructure and building at 33.68% and energy and industrial plant at 7.87%.

tickerNews.title: $NINE shareholder sells 100 million shares on 22 August 2025
tickerNews.content: $NINE: Controlling shareholder of Techno9 Indonesia, Heddy Kandou, sold 100 million NINE shares at an average price of 19 rupiah per share on 22 August 2025. The total transaction value was 1.9 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Heddy Kandou’s direct ownership decreased from 27.94% to 23.31%. The transaction is part of a plan for Poh Group Pte. Ltd. to acquire 70% of NINE, following the sale of shares by Agatha Nindya and Merry Kandou in February 2025.

tickerNews.title: $SMIL completes share buyback of approximately 4.4 million shares
tickerNews.content: $SMIL: Sarana Mitra Luas announced that it has completed a buyback of approximately 4.4 million (0.02%) shares at a execution price of 458-462 rupiah per share on 25 August 2025. The total purchase value was about 2 billion rupiah.
